com.amplifyframework.datastore

Interface DataStoreCategoryBehavior

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AWSDataStorePlugin, DataStoreCategory, DataStorePlugin

    public interface DataStoreCategoryBehavior
    A DataStore is a high-level abstraction of an object repository. The DataStore can host items which extend Model, and that are dressed with various annotations, e.g. ModelField. Model classes are auto-generated by the Amplify Gradle Plugin.
    See Also:
    Amplify Android Models and Annotations Documentation

                            Consumer<DataStoreItemChange<T>> onItemSaved,

        Saves an item into the DataStore.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The time of item being saved
        Parameters:
        item - An item to save
        onItemSaved - Called upon successful save of item
        onFailureToSave - Called upon failure to save item

      • save

        <T extends Model> void save(T item,
                            QueryPredicate predicate,
                            Consumer<DataStoreItemChange<T>> onItemSaved,
                            Consumer<DataStoreException> onFailureToSave)
        Saves an item into the DataStore if the data being overwritten meets the provided conditions. This is useful for making sure that no data is overwritten with an outdated/incorrect assumption.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The time of item being saved
        Parameters:
        item - An item to save
        predicate - Predicate condition to apply for conditional write
        onItemSaved - Called upon successful save of item
        onFailureToSave - Called upon failure to save item

        Parameters:

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of items being queried
        Parameters:
        itemClass - Items of this class will be targeted by this query
        onQueryResults - Called when a query successfully returns 0 or more results
        onQueryFailure - Called when a failure interrupts successful completion of a query

      • query

        <T extends Model> void query(java.lang.Class<T> itemClass,
                             QueryPredicate predicate,
                             Consumer<java.util.Iterator<T>> onQueryResults,
                             Consumer<DataStoreException> onQueryFailure)
        Query the DataStore to find all items of the requested Java class that fulfills the predicate.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of items being queried
        Parameters:
        itemClass - Items of this class will be targeted by this query
        predicate - Predicate condition to apply to query
        onQueryResults - Called when a query successfully returns 0 or more results
        onQueryFailure - Called when a failure interrupts successful completion of a query

      • query

        <T extends Model> void query(java.lang.Class<T> itemClass,
                             QueryOptions options,
                             Consumer<java.util.Iterator<T>> onQueryResults,
                             Consumer<DataStoreException> onQueryFailure)
        Query the DataStore to find items of the requested Java class, using the provided QueryOptions. The query options include support for filtering, paging, and sorting.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of items being queried
        Parameters:
        itemClass - Class of items that will be queried
        options - Filtering, paging, and sorting options
        onQueryResults - Called when there are results available
        onQueryFailure - Called when there is a failure that prevents results from being rendered

      • observe

        void observe(Consumer<Cancelable> onObservationStarted,
             Consumer<DataStoreItemChange<? extends Model>> onDataStoreItemChange,
             Consumer<DataStoreException> onObservationFailure,
             Action onObservationCompleted)
        Observe all changes to any/all item(s) in the DataStore.
        Parameters:
        onObservationStarted - Called when observation begins
        onDataStoreItemChange - Called 0..n times, once for each and every change that occurs to any/all item(s) in the DataStore.
        onObservationFailure - Called if observation of the DataStore terminates with a non-recoverable failure
        onObservationCompleted - Called when observation completes gracefully

      • observe

        <T extends Model> void observe(java.lang.Class<T> itemClass,
                               Consumer<Cancelable> onObservationStarted,
                               Consumer<DataStoreItemChange<T>> onDataStoreItemChange,
                               Consumer<DataStoreException> onObservationFailure,
                               Action onObservationCompleted)
        Observe changes to a certain type of item(s) in the DataStore.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the item(s) to observe
        Parameters:
        itemClass - The class of the item(s) to observe
        onObservationStarted - Called when observation begins
        onDataStoreItemChange - Called 0..n times, whenever there is a change to an item of the requested class
        onObservationFailure - Called if observation of the DataStore terminates with a non-recoverable failure
        onObservationCompleted - Called when observation completes gracefully

      • observe

        <T extends Model> void observe(java.lang.Class<T> itemClass,
                               java.lang.String uniqueId,
                               Consumer<Cancelable> onObservationStarted,
                               Consumer<DataStoreItemChange<T>> onDataStoreItemChange,
                               Consumer<DataStoreException> onObservationFailure,
                               Action onObservationCompleted)
        Observe changes to a specific item, identified by its class and unique ID.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of item being observed
        Parameters:
        itemClass - The class of the item being observed
        uniqueId - The unique ID of the item being observed
        onObservationStarted - Called when observation begins
        onDataStoreItemChange - Called 0..n times, whenever there are changes to the item which is uniquely identified by the provided class and unique ID. Note that this callback will be invoked many times for a single item, in the case where the item is updated many times.
        onObservationFailure - Called if observation of the DataStore terminates with a non-recoverable failure
        onObservationCompleted - Called when observation completes gracefully

      • observe

        <T extends Model> void observe(java.lang.Class<T> itemClass,
                               QueryPredicate selectionCriteria,
                               Consumer<Cancelable> onObservationStarted,
                               Consumer<DataStoreItemChange<T>> onDataStoreItemChange,
                               Consumer<DataStoreException> onObservationFailure,
                               Action onObservationCompleted)
        Observe a collection of item(s) that have a specified class type, and that match additional criteria, specified by a fluent chain of selection operators.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the item(s) to observe
        Parameters:
        itemClass - The class of item(s) to observe
        selectionCriteria - Additional criteria which will be considered when identifying which items in the DataStore should be observed for changes.
        onObservationStarted - Called when observation begins
        onDataStoreItemChange - Called 0..n times, whenever there are changes to models of the given class, that additionally match the provided selection criteria
        onObservationFailure - Called if observation of the DataStore terminates with a non-recoverable failure
        onObservationCompleted - Called when observation completes gracefully

      • start

        void start(Action onComplete,
           Consumer<DataStoreException> onError)
        Starts the DataStore's synchronization with a remote system, if DataStore is configured to support remote synchronization. This only needs to be called if you wish to start the synchronization eagerly. If you don't call start(), the synchronization will start automatically, prior to executing any other operations (#query, #save, #delete, #observe).
        Parameters:
        onComplete - Invoked after DataStore is initialized. This does not block until subscriptions and sync are complete. To block until sync and subscriptions are complete, use Amplify.Hub.subscribe to listen for the DataStoreChannelEventName.READY event on HubChannel.DATASTORE.
        onError - Invoked if an exception occurs.

      • stop

        void stop(Action onComplete,
          Consumer<DataStoreException> onError)
        Stops the underlying DataStore, resetting the plugin to the initialized state.
        Parameters:
        onComplete - Invoked if the call is successful.
        onError - Invoked if an exception occurs.

      • clear

        void clear(Action onComplete,
           Consumer<DataStoreException> onError)
        Stops the underlying DataStore, resetting the plugin to the initialized state, and deletes all data on the local device. Every implementation of this behavior may have its own interpretation of what clear means. This is meant to be a destructive operation that allows for safe disposal of data stored locally.
        Parameters:
        onComplete - Invoked if the call is successful.
        onError - Invoked if an exception occurs.
